Brandon.about: Hey! I'm Brandon, a third year CS major at NYU and I'm excited to be a fellow for the summer! I first got into programming my second year of high school, and since then I have not looked back. I coded a couple of basic games like pong and a card memory game over that summer and really found myself enjoying the process to the fullest!

work experience.title: Construction assistant
work experience.description: Assisted in several tasks such as cutting tiles and machines. Also, I put tile on several walls in the basement and in the bathroom. Cut my hand once, it was pretty gnarly but no scars luckily!

work experience.title: Cashier/Server
work experience.description: Did a A LOT of stuff. Took care of costumers, even helped out in the back and cooked a couple of times, since it's my family's place I was willing to do everything and still am

hobbies.title: Soccer
hobbies.description: I love everything to do with soccer. Playing it, watching it, reading about it, playing fifa, it is by far my favorite sport

hobbies.title: Formula 1
hobbies.description: I also enjoy watching formula 1. I used to find motor-racing boring (they go in circles for 50 laps how boring!) until I watched the Netflix series Drive to Survive. It helped me realize how much technique and finesse the sport requires.

Emily.about: Hi! I'm Emily! While I may be terrible at writing blurbs about myself, I'm great at learning new things and making stuff work on a tight deadline! I've been programming for almost ten years now and am excited to apply my skills towards working in a production environment.
Emily.education: Software Engineering at Ontario Tech University

work experience.title: Software Developer Co-Op
work experience.description: 4-month internship, developed internal tooling and processes for automating reporting

work experience.title: Software Developer Co-Op
work experience.description: 8-month internship, developed prototypes for internal tools

work experience.title: Innovation Developer
work experience.description: 2-month internship, worked on performance review tool for co-op students

hobbies.title: Flying
hobbies.description: I have my pilot's license and frequently rent a plane to go flying. My favorite place to go is above Toronto - I get a view of the city not many others get to experience!

hobbies.title: Skiing
hobbies.description: In the winter I love to stay active by going cross-country skiing. It's a great workout and it's rewarding to see myself improve and get faster!

Jane.about: Hello! I am a rising sophomore at Rice University. I first got into programming when my dad signed me up to take a Scratch summer program in middle school. Later in high school, I took AP Computer Science. One of my favorite memories from the course was my end-of-year project, where I had a lot of fun working with two classmates on a game of checkers. I enjoyed the collaboration of programming and am honored to be working alongside two talented group mates for this fellowship.

work experience.title: Intern
work experience.employer: Knowledge & Library Services, Harvard Business School
work experience.description: I supported the Finance and Enterprise (FES) services team with a variety of document management and finance projects, such as auditing using Excel, SharePoint Online page updates and creation. I attended and presented at team meetings as well as communicated with my mentor and FES team members in one-on-one meetings and through professional emails.

work experience.title: Intern
work experience.description: Made phone calls to medical offices to request clinical information for new patients and their families and compiles various information packets for them.

hobbies.title: Fencing
hobbies.description: In high school, I was a co-captain of the varsity co-ed fencing team junior and senior year. Our womenâ€™s team placed second and third at regional tournaments against other high schools.
